item.title: Overhanging and low hanging trees all down Vicars Hill, 17th September
item.description:
The trees on the Hilly Fields side of Vicars Hill are overhanging from the park and some are in fact low hanging. Buses everyday are hitting trees coming up the hill and occasionally knocking them off on to the pathway. With winter coming up, the sides and tops of bushes need to be completely trimmed back. There was previously a bush so low people were having to crouch underneath it until what can only be assumed as a resident on the hill has cut down. It is a danger with indivduals potentially having to step in the road or avoid falling debris if hit by large vehicles. Easily rectified with some TLC on the overhanging and low aspects of the trees/bushes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Vicars Hill, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Bins Full on pavement - Broken Mirror atop, 17th September
item.description:
Bins for 52 Pellerin Rd left out on the pavement for over a month now, the bins are overflowing, i have witnessed a fox pulling rubbish out of one. There is also a broken mirror on top of one of them. Please have a word with the residents. Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Colvestone Crecent School is a landfilled now, 17th September
item.description:
This school was so nice; now it looks disgusting, full of bottles, food, and littering of any type. People drink near where I shoot the pictures, and after they throw the bottles and any kind of rubbish in the school. Anyway, could you do something?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colvestone Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding, 17th September
item.description:
Flat number 11 has flooded my flat no 1 and the flat above no 6 THREE times in the last 3 months. I have now made an insurance claim and look to the Council to stop this happening again. It's causing damage to my flat!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
